title: How Irrigation Systems Can Increase Malaria Risk

subtasks: Prepare irrigation system by laying pipes and channels
Check water flow and adjust system for optimal water distribution
Monitor water usage and make necessary adjustments
Identify breeding sites near irrigation systems
Apply larvicide or remove standing water to eliminate mosquito habitats
Implement long-term mosquito prevention strategies, such as screening and netting
Educate farmers about the risks of malaria associated with irrigation
Explain the importance of sustained mosquito control practices
Encourage community involvement in prevention efforts
